Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: dbreviewer60763
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the hotel was SO NICE! I don't speak French, but my girlfriend does. However, all the employees speak both French and English, and they'll make things very easy for you. They helped us many times with directions and restaurant recommendations. Very clean and quiet hotel. The room we got included everything we needed - a full (bordering on queen) size bed, recliners, windows facing the street, a nice bathroom, AC/heat, and a flat screen TV. Free wifi, cable, and breakfast (delivered to your door). Parking for $15 a night in the back. And the subways and grocery stores were very close. All in all, a really nice hotel - especially for the inexpensive price!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Robert D
Reviews.Content: Comfortable and cute little hotel located across the street from Barre-UQAM, Montreal's main subway terminal. Ease of transportation was the main reason I chose the hotel - the delivered breakfast (croissants, muffins, fruit, cheese, and yogurt in a little novelty suitcase hung on the door), the quiet atmosphere, and the available parking on the side street were the reasons I'll definitely stay there again next time I'm in town. The snacks (cookies and fruit) the staff put out after 3pm was charming, everyone I talked to was courteous and pleasant, and again, the location can't be beat - walking distance to the Village, Latin Quarter, Old City, etc. From the Subway you get can everywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “a little European treasure in downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: lbp1961
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a room with a jacuzzy as a romantic getaway. This little auberge is perfect for that. The room is spacious and well divided, tv and sofa or tv and bed. The bath is wonderful. Even tought we were in downtown Montreal right on one of the busiest intersection, the room was very quiet and it was at street level. We went back since then. And we will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but charming”
Reviews.Author: JoanyC
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 1 night on November at this hotel. Before hand I looked at the website so I was already aware of the size of the rooms...which are pretty small. I had a superior room, with a jacuzzi in the bathroom but the size was like I said...very small BUT this hotel is inspired by the "Europeen Hotel Style" and in Europe, hotel rooms look like that so...no disapointment (by the way, the mastress and the pillows were SO comfortable!!). The staff was very nive and helpul, there a e a lot of services (like snacks available until 11pm and...free!). They hang on your door a continental breakfast in a basket every morning at 6h30am and I think this is quite interesting. The only "negative" point is that the rooms, for what it is, ae a bit expensive (I was lucky I had a special price but I'm talking about the regular price). I think we need to take into consideration the location but there are some other big hotel downtown that have almost the same price per night (but they don't have the continental breakfast served in a basket!! =) ). Any way, I really enjoyed my stay there, just don't expect a big room (well if you have a economic, regular or superior type of room).

Reviews.Title: “Small and cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: MzInternational
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights at that hotel, the staff were really nice and very helpful, especially Noelle- always available to answer your questions. I requested a room with a 2-person whirlpool and it was given to me. the room was nice, a bit small, but it was fine for 2 people and we didn't have much luggage. i thought it was a cute touch that we were given the baskets every morning filled with fruit, yogurt, pastries, etc. and i like that there was a space in the lobby area filled with tea, coffee, snacks. It was in a central location, the metro was right across the street. and you get free wifi in the rooms. good area, nice hotel, friendly staff...i would return there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but watch out for the parking!”
Reviews.Author: Louise C
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel, rooms were good size and clean. The location of the hotel could not be better with the Latin Quarter only a few minutes walk away. The only problem with this hotel was the parking. We had paid for parking while we were staying but noone told us that the day we were leaving we would be charged an extra $10 for staying past noon. We wouldn't have minded if someone had pointed that out to us- so just be aware of that.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: bugsbunny68
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay at the Pomerol. The service was very professional and extremely friendly. I loved the little "picnic baskets" for breakfast, and the all day open kitchenette. Very well situated. Really, nothing negative to say!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: dufresne_julie
Reviews.Content: My usband and I stayed at the Pomerol for a night in may 2011. We had a very good time. Our room was perfect ! The hotel is well situated and the staff is friendly. When we woke up the next morning, we had a delicious breakfast in a basket near our door... So, we had breakfast in the bed. I really recomand this hotel. Enjoy your stay !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - beautiful room - extremely accomodating staff”
Reviews.Author: scraplady530
Reviews.Content: We originally booked a stay here in January 2011, but due to illness we had to cancel. When we were able to finally visit Montreal I tried to save a few dollars and booked 5 nights at Hotel Visitel around the corner from Auberge Le Pomerol. That was a huge mistake. That was an awful hotel and I will write a review for them separately. So I noticed that Auberge Le Pomerol was right around the corner and I took a chance and stopped in to see if they had any rooms available. I explained the situation and they remembered we had booked for our Anniversary in January and that we were unable to make it. They were so accommodating, they had a room available for the rest of our stay and they offered it to us for a discounted rate. I asked to look at a room before I confirmed and although they couldn't show me the room we would be staying in they showed me another room. The minute I walked into the Auberge Le Pomerol I got a very warm feeling, the room I saw was beautiful, but I booked an Executive room. We came back with our things later in the day and they helped us to our room (#201). it was absolutely gorgeous. The attention to detail was unbelievable. They had an anniversary card for us on the desk along with a bottle of sparkling apple cider. There was soft music playing, which we never turned off throughout our stay. They were extremely helpful in giving us directions for places we wanted to go, the basket breakfast left on our door each morning was very cute. We will definitely be coming back to Auberge Le Pomerol. I don't understand any of the bad reviews, the location was perfect, the staff was very welcoming and the room was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “I regret being there - a big mistake”
Reviews.Author: sweetc2
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well located but that is about it. The room was extremely small and it smelled bad. The room did not look at all as we had expected. And overall the breakfast was terrible. I am a student and I was looking for a respectable hotel for a good price but this was not what I got. I was way too expensive for the service and room I had. I will never go back and will never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “special small european hotel”
Reviews.Author: selma1228
Reviews.Content: listed as a b+b, unique with very accommodating staff had every thing one could want located in edgy neighborhood which gave us no problem very convenient with superb metro station across the street continental breakfast was adequate but not very interesting wonderful value nevertheless had executive room which was wonderful if you can deal with city neighborhood which is very safe heartily recommend

Reviews.Title: “With reservations, I can recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2travel039
Reviews.Content: I have some major concerns about recommending this hotel. We stayed for two nights at the Auberge Le Pomerol. First the good things. Every employee was very warm, friendly, and helpful. The hotel was very clean and the towels, linens and bath items were very nice. There is a wonderful Italian restaurant attached to the hotel that has wonderful food with fantastic service. There is a major bus station one block from the hotel and the underground metro station is across the street. This makes travel very easy. It is within walking distance to the old town, but it is at least 15-20 minutes each way. Now the not-so-good things. Since the hotel is situated between bus and metro station, the whole area is filled with homeless, panhandling people. The park that is one block away appears to be the sleeping area for a large contingent of homeless people. This is especially concerning at night. There are also a lot of police in that area which, I assume, is due to the problems that I have mentioned. Walking in this neighborhood after dark is scary. I would not stay here if I was a single woman. A minor inconvenience is that the elevator is not on the reception level. If you have a lot of luggage, this can be a problem. Actually, if you have a lot of luggage, the rooms are not very large and that is problematic. We will not be staying here again because we did not like the neighborhood. It might be fine for some people, but I was too uncomfortable when we left the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Auberge Le Pomerol”
Reviews.Author: VagabondOklahoma
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the Latin Quarter of Montreal. It is across the street from a metro stop so that was convenient. Unfortunately, my room was on the front of the hotel and there was an African festival taking place in a park that was on the corner diagonally from the hotel. The music from the festival was so loud that I wasn't able to go to sleep even with earplugs. The desk clerk did allow me to sleep in another room that was away from the noise one night but I wasn't able to move to it because it was booked the rest of the time I was there. Breakfast was in a basket that was hung outside our room. The basket contained a number of items but most were not very tasty. I was there four nights and every morning the piece of fruit in the basket was a tangerine and the juice was orange juice. Two mornings there was a square of Philadelphia cream cheese and two mornings there was a Baby Bell cheese. There was a croissant in the basket each day but it was rather tough. Sometimes there was a muffin and sometimes there was a packaged sweet roll. Overall, I wasn't impressed by the breakfast basket. I would probably never stay in this hotel again. The rooms were all different shapes and sizes. Some people in our group had rooms with double beds that were very small with no place to put their suitcases.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: apria
Reviews.Content: Service was very poor at the front desk. Felt unwelcome. We had a romantic dinner and stay package which was a total rip off. They sent us to another location to eat where food was terrible and the menu was not even comparable. The luxury room we were promised did not live upto the pictures shown on their website..the space is so congested that I felt claustrophobic...the jacuzzi in the tub did not work. It was a total disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Very pretty, a little expensive”
Reviews.Author: Ochophobia
Reviews.Content: After being chased down the street by a man asking for change after my "boyfriend" never materialised, I chose this hotel by pure random luck. It was midnight at the bus station, no one was around, a strange man approached me for spare change. I said I had none, but when asked if I was alone, of course I said, "no, my boyfriend will be here soon", (I was travelling solo). I realised the stranger was going to wait to see if this was true - so, I high tailed it out of there and went to the first hotel I saw. Pros: * Location, very near the bus station. Was very quiet in room * Clean, well kept rooms. Cons: * A tad on the expensive side * Breakfast buffet was so scant, I doubt it was even there. Does a juice dispenser and a bowl of fruit count? Overall, a nice place to stay to escape (literally).

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay in a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dc22wh
Reviews.Content: Ideal location, extremely friendly and helpful staff. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for someplace small and romantic, in a great location, and for a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with the Pomerol”
Reviews.Author: Tiotia
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night at the centrally-located Pomerol. The personnel was nice, the room (the "executive" one) was very comfortable - and yes, the jacuzzi was working fine. There was a flatscreen tv set, a stereo, an alarm clock, everything but the bathrobe. We didn't have a nice view but that was not important. It is close to the bus terminal, the Latin quarter and the Village so there are plenty of great food and entertainment options. Continental breakfast was included (not the best croissants in town, but with jam, cheese, coffee, yougourt, etc.). For 150$ a night, it's a very good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great Location”
Reviews.Author: kweenshaker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pomerol for 3 nights last week. The staff were nothing but courteous. Our room (an economy room with 2 twins) was small but designed efficiently. The bathroom was sparkling clean. We liked the idea of our complimentary continental breakfast being delivered to our room each morning. The hotel also offers free snacks in the afternoon, but we were never around to take advantage of this. The only complaint I would have (although it did not really concern us - so it is more like a warning) is that the twin beds are arranged so they are touching and you can't move them apart. This could be awkward if you were sharing with someone you didn't know very well. Other than that, our stay was pretty much perfect. Only 2 blocks from St Denis, very close to Ste Catherine and right across the street from 3 metro lines (Berri UQAM Metro station). Some reviews complained of homeless people - yes, we saw some near the Bus Depot at Berri and Maisoneuve, but it was no worse than any other North American city. We were not approached or hassled once. It's a sad and unfortunate thing, but there are bound to be homeless people in any large city and complaining about them when they do nothing to harm us is nothing but rude. Montreal is a lovely city and next time I visit, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Lucky4547
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for three nights over the 4th of July weekend. This hotel offers excellent value. We found the location perfect, within easy walking distance to Old Montreal and other sites. Our room was small, but impeccably clean. We will gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “My Favourite!”
Reviews.Author: aranel379
Reviews.Content: I have stayed a few times in Montreal and for now the Pomerol is my personal favourite! The Auberge is well-situated, directly in downtown near the Village, just in front of a major subway station and at 2 minutes walking from the bus station. The Pomerol is quite small, but the interior is well-designed so it doesn't feel tiny at all, only cozy. We have been welcome with kind, polite and competent staff. But the greatest surprise was when we opened our bedroom's door; our superior room decoration was just perfect. So far away from a lot of kitsch hotel and inn that I have seen before. Everything is very modern and custom made for the Pomerol. I even threatened the staff that I would have to steal their painting because I wouldn't be able to find it anywhere else! We went back to the front desk and the receptionist offered me to visit the other rooms, what I did (I work for a kind of travel agency). To be honest, the economic rooms are a bit small but look good anyway. But the regular and superior rooms are worth the 20 or 40 bucks more. And the executive are just mind-blowing. Most of the rooms have a little fridge and plasma television with a DVD player where you can also listen to music. After a free snack offered by the hotel until late in the evening in the guest kitchen (including cookies, cheese, coffee, tea and other) we went to a comfy night of sleep. The breakfast in the morning is a little light but good. Muffin, crescent, jam, cheese, coffee, all at your front door when you wake up. So no need to hurry and dress up before you go out to eat! You have the chance to be lazy... So overall, the Pomerol was responsible for a great romantic get-away in Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Just what I was looking for”
Reviews.Author: CitBree
Reviews.Content: I was nervous reading the reviews on this site but I couldn't have been happier with our stay. The price was great. Granted, it was in the middle of winter and over Easter weekend, but this room was a steal. Furthermore, if you are on a tight budget, you could EASILY save money on breakfast and lunch by eating the hotel breakfast and snacks. The breakfast consists of a croissant, another type of pastry (muffin or danish), a yogurt, a piece of fruit, a package of cheese and a drink -- PER PERSON. The snacks that appear around 3pm include several types of cookies, a cheese platter, crackers and dried fruits. Plus, they have bread and peanut butter and jelly in the kitchen at all times of the day. Now, hopefully you get to sample the delicious food in Montreal, but if you really wanted to save money on food, this would be a good choice to stay. The location was perfect. It's a block from St. Denis which is covered in restaurants. And it's right across the street from the Metro. One of the reviews here said it was a block away -- not true. It's directly across the street. The staff was friendly but only somewhat helpful. They did not offer many recommendations like one of the reviews said. I also got the "go to st. Denis for food" recommendation that someone else mentioned. Also, it seems like the package they offer for the Botanical Gardens and Biodome is $5 more than what you can buy if you actually go to the Biodome to purchase tickets. We stayed in an executive suite and it was pretty nice. I travel quite frequently and, frankly, a room is a room to me unless it's a really BAD room. This room was probably above average because of the jacuzzi tub we had that we used every night. The bathroom is pretty small but not a big deal to me. The room was a decent enough size for my tastes. Compared to a room at, say a Fairmont hotel, it's much smaller (and we got the big room), but like I said, it's just a place to sleep, really. There is a lounge downstairs with a computer and a fireplace. Wireless internet available free with no password. Restaurant right next door (connected to the hotel). Walls were a little thin, but not a big problem. I could hear our neighbors TV at one point during the night, but nothing woke me up. Overall, I would DEFINITELY recommend the place and I would ABSOLUTELY stay here again if I come back to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't return”
Reviews.Author: bdhirst1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights and would not return for several reasons. The neighborhood, although probably safe, is unappealing. Many down and out folks on the streets. Nothing to recommend the buildings and stores nearby. When I returned at 10PM one night, I asked about where I could eat at that time and was told to go over to rue St. Denis and I could probably find someplace. I think that a hotel should have more knowledge of what is available and I had been along St. Denis and knew that I would not easily find a place close by. I ended up walking around and found a decent hamburger/pizza place a block away but not towards St. Denis. There were other restaurants in that direction, too, and I'd expect management to be aware of them but they seemed not to be. Looking back I think that I got what I paid for considering that Montreal is an expensive, large city. The room was OK for one and the complimentary breakfast was good. The Metro is a block away and can get you anywhere in the city. I do not speak French but everyone (including the parking attendent) was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Auberge, Fair Location”
Reviews.Author: jg1nj
Reviews.Content: We overnighted in Montreal at the Auberge Le Pomerol, 819 Boul. De Maisonneuve in July 2007. Our very clean, beautifully decorated and comfortable room had a king bed, large flat panel TV, and a Sony radio that was several grades above standard hotel issue. A large jetted-tub in the modest-size bathroom and remote for the AC capped off the feeling of small-space luxury. The inn provides some nice touches. Breakfast appears-- breads, cheese, juice, yogurt--in a closed basket hung on a hook outside your room. Cookies, dried fruits and other light snacks are available gratis in a downstairs room until 11 PM. We met only friendly and helpful staffers. We reserved the same day with the front desk at the very good price of $130 plus taxes using a "last minute" promo code obtained from Tourisme-Montreal . Free use of an off-site gym was included, but we declined. Parking is available in a private lot right behind the hotel at $14/night. For us the biggest, but not too bad, negative was the location. Although there are stores and restaurants close to the hotel, Old Montreal is not. It took these two seniors about 25 minutes to walk to Old Montreal, passing a scruffy panhandler along the way. Brisk walkers could cut that time in half. A desk clerk advised us not to walk too far towards the left out of the hotel because there is not too much good to see. Being native New Yorkers, we accept local "good sense" restrictions as part of life in any large city. A subway is very close, and taxis are always an option. A very minor inconvenience is the few steps down from the tiny lobby to the elevator. The staff willingly helps with your bags if you ask. My wife and I highly recommended this inn for leisure travelers, except for those who prefer to be closer to the old city. We very much enjoyed our brief stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice week-end”
Reviews.Author: Jackiemontreal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Pomerol over the long week-end in October, I love the room, it was very clean and the employees were very polite and very professionnal. The service at the front desk was excellent. The price were very reasonable and the location was great for shopping !

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad experience”
Reviews.Author: syndy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I drove 5 hours from Toronto and stayed 2 nights at the Pomerol. Naturally, sleep is very important for us. Upon arrival, the dÃ©cor and ambience was better than we had anticipated. But hidden under the faÃ§ade was, exposed pipes in storage room and water noises from the pipes. The Jacuzzi feature advertised was bogus. It was there alright but it didnâ€™t work. My boyfriend went to the front desk personally to tell them of the problem but was told that heâ€™ll send a technician up the next day to fix it or else heâ€™ll give us a rebate. He didnâ€™t even come up to look at it. The room is not sound- proof. Every time the neighbor turns on the tap to wash hands or to shower, we could hear. Imagine awoken up abruptly by that noise at 430 am! We complained about the noise in the morning and was told that our â€œneighborâ€� had checked out and we wonâ€™t face that problem again. 2nd day, we came back at night. The Jacuzzi still wasnâ€™t fixed so we thought weâ€™ll have a rebate. But the water noise was still there. It seems we had a NEW neighbor. Good thing they slept early. Check out. I asked about the rebate and was told that she was not informed of such arrangements and said that we were already taking the special deal and so it was not possible a further discount. Good point? It has an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: tapdancer77
Reviews.Content: This hotel I stayed at based on the good reviews I had found at BBSelect, a Canadian B&B booking agency. Unfortunately, they turned out to be dead wrong. The hotel staff treated me like I was a college student in a dormitory which I do not and did not appreciate. The evening man was very unfriendly and when I told him how rude he was to me and my friends, the manager simply explained that basically this was the hotel's "invisible policy" and that to be upfront about it would offend even more guests. I replied that he and his staff were running a dormitory and not a hotel. Although tastefully decorated, I would never give these people my money again. They advertise in gay publications as being a gay-friendly establishment; nothing could have been further from the truth.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed, but the price was a little too much”
Reviews.Author: jpidgen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Le Pomerol over the long weekend in July/August. We loved our luxury room, though it was on the pricy side considering the lack of "extras" at the hotel. For my husband & I we really wanted to have romantic surroundings which definitely was the case. We loved the contemporary decor! On that point, this hotel won hands down - it's very well styled. BUT given the price we paid, I had to pick "AVERAGE" for its review. This hotel is like a boutique hotel, and though there is wireless internet available for all the rooms, I would think that this hotel would be better suited for couples over business travellers. The hotel is ideally situated - close enough to walk to a LOT of interesting places (restaurants, bars & Old Montreal) not to mention that the METRO is right across the street from the hotel. If you don't need the hotel extras and enjoy being in the right location, then this is the hotel for you. A big downside to the hotel (as one of the other reviews mentioned) is that there are no services available other than basic maid service. I would also have to agree that given the nightly rate we paid, our expectations were not quite met either. Still, it is a large city hotel and the price was "reasonable" considering, but for the same amount of money I'll stay elsewhere next time, without the pretty decor perhaps, but WITH all the extras that one enjoys of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An experience to remember!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to Montreal many times on business trips and tried many hotels. A friend suggested this Bed and Breakfast which turned out to be one of my best experiences in this city. The location is perfect! Close enought to downtown and Old Montreal which makes after work more ineresting. The room in which I stayed offered style and comfort. The continental breakfast displayed variation. The free internet connection is a plus for people on business trips needing to keep in touch with the office. The prices are very reasonable considering the quality and cleanleness of the room. The friendly service makes it all that much more enjoyable!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on our tripp to Montreal. We are from Europe and loved the little touches of European elegance that were given to the hotel. The manager was fantastic to deal with. We will be back for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “stylish little hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnaA
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Montreal for 3 days in March 2004. Auberge Le Pomerol is convenietly located just couple minutes walk from bus station. The pictures of hotel on-line turned out to be true -contemporary nice new furniture, styly decorations, rooms and bathrooms are very clean, nice breakfast, excellent coffee, good choice of pastries and jogurt. First night we stayed in a bigger room with double-jacuzzi, TV and stereo-system. It was great. Another night we were in a standard room which was smaller but not any worse than a bigger one. Auberge has its little rustic restaurant with great service. Rue St. Denis is close with variety of cafe and restaurants. People were so friendly everywhere. Great romantic city! I was in Paris this summer and I thought that Montreal was very much Canadian "Paris".

Reviews.Title: “Great place !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a great place to stay. It's clean, the breakfast is fresh and offer many choice even if it's a continental breakfast. The employee are very polite and professionnal and the service is excellent. It was excellent, I recommand it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “The Smoke Detectors Definitely Work”
Reviews.Author: codytravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for several days and had the pleasure of hearing the smoke detectors wail each time we used the whirlpool bath or shower. Quite ironic considering the hotel promotes itself as offering a tranquil ambiance. My tranquility was interrupted by an ear-splitting smoke detector five minutes into my first whirlpool bath. I called the manager to see what could be done and was told to leave the door to our room open for a while. Think about that security risk for a minute! The rooms look fine at first glance but can really use some touch-ups. The towels are really thin, small and scarce. The shower hardware fell off several times. The floor in our room was very uneven. The room was extremely small but at least it was clean. Overall, a huge disappointment. The neighborhood is also sketchy. We will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Auberge Le Pomerol”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Husband, Son and I stayed at the B&B this past June. We have been to various hotels in BC, and ON, California and NY and Greece. This was one of the best accommodations we've experienced. Stylish rooms, friendly service at breakfast time, reasonably priced and the restaurant was excellent! Convenient location, though neighborhood is transitioning. They made a mistake by not mentioning that only children older than 10 yrs. old are allowed, but made an exception with our young Son (they already took our reservation).

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this B&B last August and loved it. The ambience is great, the price was reasonable and the location is perfect. We stayed in one of the regular rooms - it was average size, but very nicely furnished. Across the street was a metro station, which made getting around very easy. Breakfast was nice, and there was an internet connection available (free) if you needed to check email, or check out restaurants to eat at. The location is very close to the old part of the city, but it is also right on the edge of the "Village", which is a little funky. It's not threatening, or unsightly, but some people don't care for that kind of thing, so I thought I would point it out. Would I go to this B&B again? Absolutely, I intend to.

HotelInfo.Name: Auberge Le Pomerol
HotelInfo.Address: 819 Blvd de Maisonneuve East, Montreal, Quebec H2L 1Y7, Canada
